metadata.synopsis: Lae'zel at a party orginized by Withers.Variants:Astral projection from Space w/ PlayerAstral projection from Space w/o PlayerStayed in FaerunNot present if was on Vlaakith PathGenerally speaking, Lae'zel should be confident but a much softer version than before, at least in terms of tone with the player. She is forever a warrior, but she values friendship, camaraderie.

103.speaker: Lae'zel
103.text: For two months we trained as Knights of the Comet. For two more we skewered kith'raki bellies. And for two more yet we travelled through Limbo.

132.speaker: Lae'zel
132.text: It has taken all of Orpheus' efforts to conjure our projections here - and all of mine to convince him to let us come.

290.speaker: Lae'zel
290.text: Worth it, I'd say. Right here, right now, there's no other place I'd sooner be.

108.speaker: Lae'zel
108.context: NodeContext: In good spirits, glad to be where she is

601.speaker: Lae'zel
601.text: I thought slicing through the wings of a pit fiend would be the pinnacle of my month -

623.speaker: Lae'zel
623.text: - but seeing you brings me more pleasure than gutting every last hellfiend of Avernus.
623.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel went to the Hells with Karlach. She loves the battles, but looking forward to helping Karlach come home.

594.speaker: Player
594.text: Do you regret turning from Orpheus' cause and joining Karlach in the Hells?

316.speaker: Player
316.text: Do you regret turning from Vlaakith and joining Karlach in the Hells?

98.speaker: Player
98.text: I still can't believe it. Githyanki and tiefling, fighting side by side in Avernus.

275.speaker: Lae'zel
275.text: I learned much from my time in Faerûn. Battle is more brutal - and the celebration after more glorious - with a fiery companion at your side.

333.speaker: Player
333.text: It's good to see you, too.

100.speaker: Lae'zel
100.text: I learned much from my time with you in Faerûn. For instance, that battle is more brutal - and the celebration after more glorious - with a fiery companion at your side.

68.speaker: Lae'zel
68.text: I couldn't wish for a life more furious, more bloody, and more fitting for a gith warrior - or a battle partner as mighty as Karlach.

466.speaker: Lae'zel
466.text: She bests me at every turn. I could build a fortress the size of Castle Susurrus with all the horns she's ripped from rampaging orthons.

473.speaker: Lae'zel
473.text: But Avernus may not be her forever home. There's a chance - well, you should speak with her yourself, if you haven't already.

7.speaker: Lae'zel
7.text: My story is Karlach's now. It may never be written in the githyanki slates, but it will be legendary all the same.

266.speaker: Player
266.text: And what of the egg you took? Has it hatched?

230.speaker: Lae'zel
230.text: So it has - and a fine man the hatchling will be. I call him Xan. 'Freedom'.

339.speaker: Lae'zel
339.text: And before you ask, yes, he is safe. I keep him secure in a portable hole - and have torn new openings into every fiend that's wandered anywhere near.

291.speaker: Lae'zel
291.text: It won't be long before he's doing the tearing - if that's what he wishes.

6.speaker: Lae'zel
6.text: I was afforded a destiny of my own choosing. When he comes of age, it is only right I give Xan the same.

249.speaker: Player
249.text: I wish I could share the enthusiasm.

523.speaker: Lae'zel
523.text: Ah - a curmudgeon tonight, are we? Is that the right word - 'curmudgeon'?

432.speaker: Lae'zel
432.text: Well, like it or not, I learned much from my time with you in Faerûn. For instance, that battle is more brutal - and the celebration after more glorious - with a fiery companion at your side.

154.speaker: Lae'zel
154.text: This is... nice. Yes. I think that's the right word for it.

81.speaker: Lae'zel
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. Happy to be here, to have a break from killing Vlaakith's agents.NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO

455.speaker: Lae'zel
455.text: I thought slaying Vlaakith's hunters in the cliffs of Sword's Teeth might be the month's pinnacle.

218.speaker: Lae'zel
218.text: Duke Wyll Ravengard. Zhak vo'n'fynh duj.
218.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. Happy to be here, to have a break from killing Vlaakith's agents.NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO

497.speaker: Lae'zel
497.text: The Blade of Avernus. Zhak vo'n'fynh duj.
497.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. Happy to be here, to have a break from killing Vlaakith's agents.NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO

386.speaker: Lae'zel
386.text: The Blade of Frontiers. Zhak vo'n'fynh duj.
386.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. Happy to be here, to have a break from killing Vlaakith's agents.NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO

351.speaker: Lae'zel
351.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. Happy to be here, to have a break from killing Vlaakith's agents.NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO

412.speaker: Lae'zel
412.text: I thought slaying Vlaakith's hunters in the cliffs of Sword's Teeth might be the month's pinnacle.

369.speaker: Lae'zel
369.text: But I was wrong. Being right here, with you, is an infinitely greater pleasure.

341.context: CinematicNodeContext: There's a pause. Lae'zel takes in the surroundings, then smiles at the player.

578.speaker: Lae'zel
578.text: Alas, I can only rest so long. I've got wind of a githyanki outpost hidden deep in Chult. The last of Vlaakith's Sword Coast strongholds.

535.speaker: Lae'zel
535.text: How about you help me raze it to the ground, put those godly powers to good use?

299.speaker: Lae'zel
299.text: Alas, I can only rest so long. I've got wind of a githyanki outpost hidden deep in Chult. The last of Vlaakith's Sword Coast strongholds.

193.speaker: Lae'zel
193.text: I say we sneak in under cover of night. We slit every last throat and you feed until your belly's full.

269.speaker: Lae'zel
269.text: I say we sneak in under cover of night. We slit every last throat and you feed until your belly's full.

311.speaker: Player
311.text: Raiding a githyanki stronghold? Hardly behaviour becoming of the god of ambition.

297.speaker: Lae'zel
297.text: Of course. Mortals are meant to worship and obey. What other role might they possibly play in the life of a god?
297.context: NodeContext: A bit snotty. She's hurt.

382.speaker: Lae'zel
382.text: Well. Why don't you go and mingle? That's the word, right? 'Mingle?'
382.context: NodeContext: A bit snotty. She's hurt.

25.speaker: Lae'zel
25.text: If you so deign to speak with your lessers, that is.
25.context: NodeContext: A bit snotty. She's hurt.

224.speaker: Player
224.text: I love you, Lae'zel. To know you is an honour and a pleasure.

564.speaker: Lae'zel
564.text: Love. Until I knew you, I thought the mere idea a joke. A weakness indulged only by lesser species.

59.speaker: Lae'zel
59.text: You proved me a fool. I am forever grateful.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Reach out to Lae'zel. Seek the warmth of her touch.

37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

216.speaker: Lae'zel
216.text: A taste I've missed. So very much.

453.speaker: Lae'zel
453.text: A taste I will never grow tired of.

376.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

213.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

583.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

204.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

169.speaker: Lae'zel
169.text: Speak to me, Source of my Joy.

419.speaker: Player
419.text: I love you, Lae'zel. To know you is an honour and a pleasure.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: And our little hatchling? Is he safe?

127.speaker: Lae'zel
127.text: Of course. I have complete trust in our newest allies. Xan is in fine hands tonight.

447.speaker: Lae'zel
447.text: What a wonder he is. He will be a fine warrior, if he chooses. Or a poet, or an explorer, or a scholar.

310.speaker: Player
310.text: And our little hatchling? Is he safe?

469.speaker: Player
469.text: What has become of the egg, Lae'zel? Has it hatched?

399.speaker: Player
399.text: What has become of the egg, Lae'zel? Has it hatched?

182.speaker: Lae'zel
182.text: So it has. I call him Xan. 'Freedom'.

449.speaker: Lae'zel
449.text: Tonight, he is safe among people I proudly call friends.

385.speaker: Player
385.text: Have you heard word from Orpheus since his departure?

321.speaker: Lae'zel
321.text: I have not heard tell of him, nor has my mind felt his presence.

2.speaker: Lae'zel
2.text: It seems Gith's son has been lost to the shadows. Perhaps one day, he will step into the light.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: If you pray to me during battle, I might aid you.

105.speaker: Lae'zel
105.context: NodeContext: A bit snotty. She's hurt.

621.speaker: Lae'zel
621.text: I suppose to you, mortals are meant only to worship and obey. What other role might they possibly play in the life of a god?
621.context: NodeContext: A bit snotty. She's hurt.

573.speaker: Player
573.text: I am sorry, Lae'zel, but I must decline.

592.speaker: Lae'zel
592.text: Of course you must. What good is a mortal to a god, if she dares not to offer fealty?
592.context: NodeContext: A bit snotty. She's hurt.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I'm in. We'll set out within the tenday.

424.speaker: Lae'zel
424.text: You always did have a great fire in your belly. I'm glad to be the one to keep it kindled.

606.speaker: Lae'zel
606.text: You always did have a great fire in your belly. I am glad to see you have kept it kindled.

630.speaker: Player
630.text: I can't wait! Bet Bhaal never thought I'd get this far.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I'm going to enjoy tonight's respite while we can. We'll talk about this later.

251.speaker: Lae'zel
251.text: Right you are - not every night is for spilling blood. I shouldn't be so callous as to spoil the quiet pleasures of this one.

510.speaker: Player
510.text: Let's take some time off, enjoy life. Vlaakith's forces will find us soon enough.

452.speaker: Lae'zel
452.text: *Sigh* I suppose you are right. We have seen too much black and red these last months.

613.speaker: Lae'zel
613.text: Waukeentide is to start soon in Waterdeep, as I understand it. You are due a hometown celebration - a gust of bright colours among familiar streets.

608.speaker: Lae'zel
608.text: Waukeentide is to start soon in Waterdeep, as I understand it. We are due a celebration - a gust of bright colours.

168.speaker: Lae'zel
168.text: A tenday of good wine, good music - and the best company: yours.

550.speaker: Lae'zel
550.text: Now go, mingle while you can. That's the word, right? 'Mingle?'

246.speaker: Player
246.text: No. This is your battle to fight, not mine.

632.speaker: Player
632.text: I wouldn't say no to a big feeding. I'd hate for all those memories to go to waste.

486.speaker: Lae'zel
486.text: A githyanki leading a ghaik to feed on her own people. Not even the greatest senja'si could have conjured such a vision.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: A veritable bloodbath, you say? How could I refuse, darling?

214.speaker: Lae'zel
214.text: Ah - your endless charms are exceeded only by your endless appetites, Astarion.

508.speaker: Lae'zel
508.text: Just be sure to keep me on the menu.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I wish I could. But I must see to vital city business.

264.speaker: Lae'zel
264.text: Understood. A Grand Duke's duties extend beyond gutting githyanki assassins.

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: I need you - but the city needs you more.

505.speaker: Player
505.text: Of course I'll join you. Avernus will still be burning when we return.

409.speaker: Player
409.text: Of course I'll join you. My duty is to vanquish any and all dangers to the Sword Coast.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: Why not? I think I can tear myself away from the temple for a bit.

267.speaker: Lae'zel
267.text: My love, my Shadowheart. To think there was a time when we were at each others' throats.

163.speaker: Narrator
163.text: *'Love'. The word hangs in the air for a moment before Lae'zel continues, unfazed.*

392.speaker: Lae'zel
392.text: We'll devise a plan of attack soon enough. For now, why don't you go and mingle? That's the word, right? 'Mingle?'

443.speaker: Lae'zel
443.text: I won't be far. Not tonight. Not ever.

477.speaker: Lae'zel
477.text: To think there was a time when we were at each others' throats.

524.speaker: Player
524.text: I can't. I've been away from my parents for far too long already.

543.speaker: Lae'zel
543.text: I understand. I need you, love - but they need you even more.

131.speaker: Lae'zel
131.text: I'll set off on my own tomorrow.

260.speaker: Lae'zel
260.text: Look out for me two months from now. I'll return to your arms, as surely as K'liir will forever circle the Sun.

634.speaker: Player
634.text: I can't. I've been away from my parents for far too long already.

602.speaker: Lae'zel
602.text: I mean to slay every last sarth and kith'rak. And I mean for Baldur's Gate's grandest duke to join me.

607.speaker: Lae'zel
607.text: I mean to slay every last sarth and kith'rak. And I mean for the Blade of Avernus to join me.

360.speaker: Lae'zel
360.text: I mean to slay every last sarth and kith'rak. And I mean for the Blade of Frontiers to join me.

590.speaker: Lae'zel
590.text: If Mizora lets you off her leash, that is.

456.speaker: Lae'zel
456.text: I mean to slay every last sarth and kith'rak. And I mean for Shar's favoured daughter to join me.

16.speaker: Lae'zel
16.text: I mean to slay every last sarth and kith'rak. And I mean for you to join me.

554.speaker: Lae'zel
554.text: I thought watching you slay Vlaakith's hunters in the cliffs of Sword's Teeth might be the month's pinnacle.

390.speaker: Lae'zel
390.text: When you bid me to stay in Faerûn, to vanquish Vlaakith assassins, I was hoping I might do so at your side.

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.text: But I respect that you chose as you did. Tell me you've kept count of your kills, at very least.

415.speaker: Player
415.text: 128 imps, 42 dretch, 6 balor, and one particularly feisty abyssal chicken.

265.speaker: Lae'zel
265.text: Feisty indeed, if it troubled a warrior as seasoned as you - and as exquisite.

362.speaker: Player
362.text: It never crossed my mind to keep track.

244.speaker: Lae'zel
244.text: Well, it is time you start counting your corpses. I'll expect a detailed accounting when I next see you.

605.speaker: Player
605.text: I'd rather hear of your own conquests.

349.speaker: Lae'zel
349.text: Ha! Worried yours can't compare? Very well.
349.context: NodeContext: Said with affection and cheekiness.

116.speaker: Lae'zel
116.text: Two Sword Coast strongholds of sixty of the queen's loyalists each, a raiding camp of twenty, and eight minor scouting parties. In all, twelve sarth and two kith'raki have fallen to my blade.

258.speaker: Lae'zel
258.text: Nngh. The thought of you sweaty from battle - It is all I can do not to ravish you, here and now. Perhaps we might find time later for a bit of... indulgence.
258.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel looks you over, then breathes deep.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Yes. Hells, how I've missed your body.

15.speaker: Lae'zel
15.text: Later, then. When the music has died down and our friends' eyes have gone half-lidded.

343.speaker: Player
343.text: Let's see where the night takes us.

153.speaker: Lae'zel
153.text: As you wish. I do hope it leads to surprises. Pleasant, steamy surprises.

319.speaker: Lae'zel
319.context: NodeContext: Harsh words, but genial tone.

301.speaker: Lae'zel
301.text: The one who took Orpheus from me. The one who condemned the githyanki people to slavery.
301.context: NodeContext: Harsh words, but genial tone.

461.speaker: Lae'zel
461.text: I slayed Vlaakith's hunters in the cliffs of Sword's Teeth and the wetlands of Lizard Marsh.
461.context: NodeContext: Harsh words, but genial tone.

270.speaker: Lae'zel
270.text: Part of me believes the ghaik before me should meet the same fate -
270.context: NodeContext: Harsh words, but genial tone.

280.speaker: Lae'zel
280.text: - but truth is, I'm glad to see you. I wouldn't even deny it with Vlaakith's vorpal blade at my neck. Though I'd rather it not come to that.
280.context: NodeContext: Harsh words, but genial tone.

278.speaker: Lae'zel
278.text: Of course, there are ways you might make amends.
278.context: NodeContext: Harsh words, but genial tone.

579.speaker: Lae'zel
579.text: I've got wind of a githyanki outpost hidden deep in Chult. The last of Vlaakith's Sword Coast strongholds.

468.speaker: Lae'zel
468.text: I don't suppose you'd consider fleeing the Hells and joining me there to slay every last sarth and kith'rak.

49.speaker: Lae'zel
49.text: I say we sneak in under cover of night. We slit every last throat and you feed until your belly's full.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I wouldn't say no to a big feeding. I'd hate for all those memories to go to waste.

404.speaker: Lae'zel
404.text: There is plenty of time yet for slicing scalps and tasting blood.

331.speaker: Player
331.text: I'm going to enjoy tonight's respite while we can. We'll talk about this later.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I owe no amends. You're on your own.

285.speaker: Lae'zel
285.text: Disappointing. But I won't argue - my heart has no room for new grudges.

287.speaker: Lae'zel
287.text: Go, mingle while you can. That's the word, right? 'Mingle?'

248.speaker: Lae'zel
248.text: That's my strapping girl. Burning hot - but not too hot, praise Withers.
248.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. Happy to be here, to have a break from killing Vlaakith's agents.

128.speaker: Lae'zel
128.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. Happy to be here, to have a break from killing Vlaakith's agents.

340.speaker: Lae'zel
340.text: Old friend. So different from when we first met.
340.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. Happy to be here, to have a break from killing Vlaakith's agents.

146.speaker: Lae'zel
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. Happy to be here, to have a break from killing Vlaakith's agents.

198.speaker: Lae'zel
198.text: The Blade of Avernus, old friend.
198.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. Happy to be here, to have a break from killing Vlaakith's agents.

166.speaker: Lae'zel
166.text: The Blade of Frontiers, my old friend.
166.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. Happy to be here, to have a break from killing Vlaakith's agents.

437.speaker: Lae'zel
437.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. Happy to be here, to have a break from killing Vlaakith's agents.NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO

188.speaker: Lae'zel
188.text: Chk. A god stoops to walk among us.

104.speaker: Lae'zel
104.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not sure she's happy to see you at first, but she comes around. But she starts with her old greeting.

537.speaker: Lae'zel
537.text: I never imagined we'd be standing toe to toe on this day, in this place.

44.speaker: Lae'zel
44.text: Nothing but allies, I always told myself. A necessary partnership. But in spite of every strained word, every barbed glance -

144.speaker: Lae'zel
144.text: - seeing your wonderful, hideous face brings me more pleasure than taking a royal inquisitor's head.

364.speaker: Lae'zel
364.text: - seeing Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard brings me even more pleasure than taking a royal inquisitor's head.

142.speaker: Lae'zel
142.text: - seeing the Blade of Avernus brings me even more pleasure than taking a royal inquisitor's head.

35.speaker: Lae'zel
35.text: Were it not for you, I might not have known the value of partnership. Connection.

276.speaker: Lae'zel
276.text: I've found new allies, now. New... friends. People I trust, and who trust me in return.

545.speaker: Lae'zel
545.text: We've heard word of a githyanki outpost hidden deep in Chult. The last of Vlaakith's Sword Coast strongholds.

69.speaker: Lae'zel
69.text: I don't suppose you'd consider fleeing the Hells and joining us there to slay every last sarth and kith'rak.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I'm sorry, Lae'zel. I belong at Karlach's side.

417.speaker: Lae'zel
417.text: Your loyalty to her knows no bounds. Nor, it seems, does your fortitude.
417.context: NodeContext: Impressed with player, and admitting it at last.

106.speaker: Lae'zel
106.text: You impressed me from the beginning, you know. It was my own foolish pride that ever kept me from admitting it - to you, or myself.
106.context: NodeContext: Impressed with player, and admitting it at last.

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: I - I just wanted you to know that.
55.context: NodeContext: Impressed with player, and admitting it at last.

553.speaker: Lae'zel
553.text: We'll meet again. The Hells are too small to contain a soul as tremendous as yours.

560.speaker: Player
560.text: Have you heard word from Orpheus, by chance?

117.speaker: Lae'zel
117.text: I have not heard tell of him, nor has my mind felt his presence.

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.text: It seems Gith's son has been lost to the shadows. Perhaps one day, he will step into the light.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: What about the egg you took with you? Has it hatched?

125.speaker: Lae'zel
125.text: So it has - and a fine man the hatchling will be. I call him Xan. 'Freedom'.

317.speaker: Lae'zel
317.text: Before you ask: yes, he is safe - in the care of people I trust.

151.speaker: Lae'zel
151.text: Xan will be a fine warrior, if he chooses. Or a poet, or an explorer, or a scholar.

347.speaker: Lae'zel
347.text: I was afforded a destiny of my own choosing. When he comes of age, it is only right I give Xan the same.

189.speaker: Player
189.text: I wish I could. But I'm stuck killing devils in Avernus.

627.speaker: Lae'zel
627.text: You say 'stuck' - and still you stay. Your devotion to Karlach knows no bounds. Nor, it seems, does your fortitude.

225.speaker: Lae'zel
225.text: Ah. Well, a harsh 'no' is as reasonable an answer as any. I wasn't always the most... gracious ally. But there's something I'd have you know:

137.speaker: Lae'zel
137.text: You impressed me from the beginning. It was my own foolish pride that ever kept me from admitting it - to you, or myself.
137.context: NodeContext: Impressed with player, and admitting it at last.

614.speaker: Lae'zel
614.text: By Mother Gith's Blade, I wish you could join us.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: Go give 'em hell, soldier. And grab me a souvenir while you're there.

538.speaker: Lae'zel
538.text: I'll save the bloodiest sarth scalp from the heap, just for you.

356.speaker: Player
356.text: If only. I've got my hands more than full in Avernus.

240.speaker: Lae'zel
240.text: And yet you live. Zariel could never hope to slaughter a soul as tremendous as yours.

454.speaker: Lae'zel
454.text: I'm proud of you. Always was.

618.speaker: Lae'zel
618.text: This may be the last time we come together. Make these moments count.

322.speaker: Player
322.text: That makes one of us. This was only ever your fight, Lae'zel - not mine.

332.speaker: Lae'zel
332.text: Perhaps you might join us. Help us raze it to the ground, put those godly powers to good use.

384.speaker: Lae'zel
384.text: Perhaps you might join us - sneak in under cover of night. We slit every last throat and you feed until your belly's full.

525.speaker: Lae'zel
525.text: Perhaps you might join us - sneak in under cover of night. We slit every last throat and you feed until your belly's full.

503.speaker: Lae'zel
503.text: We mean to slay every last sarth and kith'rak. Perhaps Baldur's Gate's grandest duke would care to join us.

101.speaker: Lae'zel
101.text: We mean to slay every last sarth and kith'rak. Perhaps the Blade of Avernus would care to join us.

407.speaker: Lae'zel
407.text: We mean to slay every last sarth and kith'rak. Perhaps the Blade of Frontiers would care to join us.

65.speaker: Lae'zel
65.text: We mean to slay every last sarth and kith'rak. Perhaps the Shar's most favoured daughter would care to join us.

570.speaker: Lae'zel
570.text: We mean to slay every last sarth and kith'rak. Perhaps the Challenger of Gods would care to join us.

546.speaker: Lae'zel
546.text: We mean to slay every last sarth and kith'rak. I thought perhaps you'd care to join us.

286.speaker: Lae'zel
286.text: - seeing the Blade of Frontiers brings me even more pleasure than taking a royal inquisitor's head.

615.speaker: Lae'zel
615.text: - seeing you brings me even more pleasure than taking a royal inquisitor's head.

504.speaker: Lae'zel
504.text: This is... nice. Yes. I think that's the right word for it.

507.speaker: Lae'zel
507.text: That's my strapping girl. Burning hot - but not too hot, praise Withers.
507.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel went to the Hells with Karlach. She loves the battles, but looking forward to helping Karlach come home.

496.speaker: Lae'zel
496.text: It's incredible, isn't it? To be anywhere but sizzling in the hottest of Hells.

344.speaker: Lae'zel
344.text: I've slaughtered more fiends in the last month than I thought swarmed the whole of Avernus.

463.speaker: Lae'zel
463.text: And still you best me at every turn. I could build a fortress the size of Castle Susurrus with all the horns you've ripped from rampaging orthons.

330.speaker: Lae'zel
330.text: It's time - you deserve your freedom from the fires. I can't believe it's almost in reach.

152.speaker: Narrator
152.text: *You think back on the cambion you slayed a tenday ago. It carried a map with directions and blueprints for Zariel's own, private forge.*

492.speaker: Narrator
492.text: *The current plan: sneak in, grab a smith, and force him to repair or replace your heart so you can live outside Avernus.*

528.speaker: Player
528.text: Fuck yeah. Next stop, Zariel's forge. Final stop, Faerûn.

361.speaker: Lae'zel
361.text: Dear Karlach. I thought slicing through the wings of a pit fiend would be the pinnacle of my month.

272.speaker: Lae'zel
272.text: But seeing you here tonight, your eyes so bright, your smile so wide - nothing could bring me more joy than that.

597.speaker: Lae'zel
597.text: My story is yours now, Karlach. It may never be written in the githyanki slates, but it will be legendary all the same.

284.speaker: Player
284.text: Nothing is a sure thing. Try not to get your hopes up, soldier.

208.speaker: Lae'zel
208.text: My hopes are only ever as strong as the woman standing before me now.

345.speaker: Lae'zel
345.text: Maybe there's no forge. Maybe we find a party of pit fiends or a hundred chain devils waiting for us. So what? We'll slice them into chunks like all the others.

338.speaker: Player
338.text: Something's nagging at me. Could be a trap. The sort Zariel likes to set.

84.speaker: Lae'zel
84.text: So maybe we find a party of pit fiends or a hundred chain devils waiting for us. We'll slice them into chunks like all the others.

411.speaker: Lae'zel
411.text: And then we carry on through the fires until we see blue sky again.

256.speaker: Lae'zel
256.text: My story is yours now, Karlach. It may never be written in the githyanki slates, but it will be legendary all the same. No matter how it ends.

516.speaker: Player
516.text: Is our little hatchling Xan secure in his portable hole?

353.speaker: Player
353.text: Is our little hatchling Xan secure in his portable hole?

259.speaker: Lae'zel
259.text: Xan is safe - don't you worry that horned head of yours.

247.speaker: Lae'zel
247.text: Besides, if anyone so much as looked at him funny, I know you'd turn them to bloodchunks.

318.speaker: Lae'zel
318.text: Something in his eyes tells me he'll take after you more than me. A hellshunter with a graceful soul and a burning heart.

596.speaker: Lae'zel
596.text: For two months we trained the Knights of the Comet. For two more we skewered kith'raki bellies. And for two more yet we travelled through Limbo.

500.speaker: Lae'zel
500.text: It's taken a dozen gishes' talents and a few stolen psi crystals, and two tendays of effort to conjure our projections here.

253.speaker: Lae'zel
253.text: Worth every one of those days and every drop of their sweat. Right here, right now, there's no other place I'd sooner be.

195.speaker: Lae'zel
195.text: Enjoy your night, chatter away. For tomorrow, we face Zaerith Menyar-Ag-Gith.

274.speaker: Narrator
274.text: *Zaerith Menyar-Ag-Gith. How well you know the name - the immortal god-king of the githzerai, and ruler of their capital, Shra'kt'lor.*

261.speaker: Narrator
261.text: *And how glad you are that the plane of Limbo remains untouched by the sun.*

58.speaker: Player
58.text: It's still hard to believe. The great warrior Lae'zel, on a diplomatic mission.

582.speaker: Lae'zel
582.text: Heh. I was as surprised as anyone when Orpheus spoke the order, my love.

587.speaker: Lae'zel
587.text: Heh. I was as surprised as anyone when Orpheus spoke the order.

460.speaker: Player
460.text: Do you really think Menyar-Ag-Gith will help us destroy Vlaakith?

527.speaker: Lae'zel
527.text: I do. Menyar-Ag-Gith is an ascetic. He reached out in good faith. He will aid us if we meet him in the same spirit, my love.

509.speaker: Lae'zel
509.text: And if he refuses, we carry on. Gravity pulls us in but one direction.

289.speaker: Lae'zel
289.text: I do. Menyar-Ag-Gith is an ascetic. He reached out in good faith. He will aid us if we meet him in the same spirit.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I still think it's a trap. The god-king will slay us the moment we show our faces.

381.speaker: Lae'zel
381.text: Menyar-Ag-Gith is an ascetic. He reached out in good faith. This is his way. It is in this spirit that we must meet him, my love.

113.speaker: Lae'zel
113.text: Menyar-Ag-Gith is an ascetic. He reached out in good faith. This is his way. It is in this spirit that we must meet him.

471.speaker: Player
471.text: It makes my stomach churn. Githzerai should be gutted, not bargained with.

150.speaker: Lae'zel
150.text: We've spilled blood, gained a foothold in the Astral. But still, we need allies. And one beyond reckoning has made himself known.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: A githzerai alliance - incredible. Could the gith unite under one sky once again?

76.speaker: Lae'zel
76.text: You might as well ask if the stars will ever snuff out, or Avernus freeze over. A consideration for the far future.

200.speaker: Lae'zel
200.text: For now, I don't want the githzerai to fight for us - just with us, my love.

227.speaker: Lae'zel
227.text: For now, I don't want the githzerai to fight for us - just with us.

567.speaker: Lae'zel
567.text: He is also a near-deity. Should the githzerai join us, we could topple The City of Death in a red dragon's blink.

539.speaker: Lae'zel
539.text: Trust me - my blade is keen as ever. But it was here, in Faerûn, where I learned a proper victory doesn't always require a razor-sharp edge.

304.speaker: Lae'zel
304.text: And if Menyar-Ag-Gith refuses, we carry on. Gravity pulls us in but one direction.

375.speaker: Lae'zel
375.text: I am the Comet. We will blaze forth until we burn Vlaakith's bones to ash and smash her phylactery to pieces.

252.speaker: Lae'zel
252.text: We are Warriors of the Comet. We will blaze forth until we burn Vlaakith's bones to ash and smash her phylactery to pieces.

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.text: And when the Comet has risen, we will be forever together, as surely as K'liir will forever circle the Sun.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: I love you, Lae'zel. To fight at your side is an honour and a pleasure.

292.speaker: Lae'zel
292.text: Love. Until I knew you, I thought the mere idea a joke. A weakness indulged only by lesser species.

3.speaker: Lae'zel
3.text: You proved me a fool. I am forever grateful.

427.speaker: Player
427.text: Reach out to Lae'zel. Seek the warmth of her touch.

512.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

302.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

221.speaker: Lae'zel
221.text: A taste I will never grow tired of.

426.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

517.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

387.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

485.speaker: Lae'zel
485.text: Speak to me, Source of my Joy.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: If only Orpheus could have shared in our victories.

441.speaker: Lae'zel
441.text: I admit - I've longed for his guiding wisdom more than once. But I have not heard tell of him, nor has my mind felt his presence.

629.speaker: Lae'zel
629.text: Gith's son has been lost to the shadows. Perhaps one day, when the lich queen is dust, he will step into the light.

610.speaker: Lae'zel
610.text: And when the Comet has risen, the githyanki will be free. Free to act, free to speak. Through us, they will feel the embrace of Mother Gith.

243.speaker: Lae'zel
243.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj. Scorching hot as ever - but not too hot, praise Withers.
243.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. She has been in service to Orpheus' cause, but happy to be here.

50.speaker: Lae'zel
50.text: Duke Wyll Ravengard. Zhak vo'n'fynh duj.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. She has been in service to Orpheus' cause, but happy to be here.NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO

575.speaker: Lae'zel
575.text: The Blade of Avernus. Zhak vo'n'fynh duj.
575.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. She has been in service to Orpheus' cause, but happy to be here.NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO

501.speaker: Lae'zel
501.text: The Blade of Frontiers. Zhak vo'n'fynh duj.
501.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. She has been in service to Orpheus' cause, but happy to be here.NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO

519.speaker: Lae'zel
519.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. She has been in service to Orpheus' cause, but happy to be here.NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO

403.speaker: Lae'zel
403.text: For two months Orpheus trained me in the ways of the Comet. For two more I skewered kith'raki bellies. And for two more yet I travelled through Limbo.

542.speaker: Lae'zel
542.text: But nothing has made me quiver more than seeing your face here today.

401.speaker: Narrator
401.text: *Limbo, she'd said. A plane of chaos, where you might drink fire like water, where you might breathe ice instead of air -*

423.speaker: Narrator
423.text: *- and the home of the mystical githzerai. Once, the githzerai were one with the githyanki - until bloody civil war severed them.*

536.speaker: Lae'zel
536.text: Worth it, I'd say. I missed this place. This - ahem - 'Fay-run'.
536.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a big smile. A reference to her misponunciation earlier in the game.

296.speaker: Lae'zel
296.text: But soon - soon I'll find some way to see you in flesh. To touch you as you are meant to be touched.

465.speaker: Player
465.text: You're looking a bit less... 'solid' than I expected.

609.speaker: Player
609.text: Not like this. I want to feel you in the flesh.

42.speaker: Lae'zel
42.text: Worth it, I'd say. I missed this place. This - ahem - 'Fay-run'.
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a big smile. A reference to her misponunciation earlier in the game.

561.speaker: Player
561.text: Where are you now, that you couldn't be here in the flesh?

568.speaker: Narrator
568.text: *Shra'kt'lor. How well you know the name - the capital city of the githzerai, and the home of their immortal god-king, Zaerith Menyar-Ag-Gith.*

178.speaker: Lae'zel
178.text: Our gish sent word of the rebellion to Menyar-Ag-Gith through the cosmos. He's agreed to parley.

593.speaker: Narrator
593.text: *Shra'kt'lor - you recall the name. The capital city of the githzerai, and the home of their immortal god-king, Zaerith Menyar-Ag-Gith.*

229.speaker: Player
229.text: Shra'kt'lor? I've never heard of it. Should I have?

71.speaker: Lae'zel
71.text: I wouldn't expect you to. The capital city of the githzerai - an exiled people, once kin with mine until the madness of civil war ripped our one sky into two.
71.context: NodeContext: Friendly. She's reassuring player they don't need to pretent o understand when they don't.

255.speaker: Player
255.text: Sounds foreboding. I presume you're there on business, not pleasure?

282.speaker: Lae'zel
282.text: Let's say 'both'. I can't imagine a greater pleasure than Vlaakith's unmaking.

367.speaker: Player
367.text: Nod your head as if the word means anything at all to you.

185.speaker: Lae'zel
185.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj. No need to pretend - I know the word means little to you.
185.context: NodeContext: Friendly and sweet. She's reassuring player they don't need to pretend to understand when they don't.

235.speaker: Lae'zel
235.text: No need to pretend - I know the word means little to you.
235.context: NodeContext: Friendly and sweet. She's reassuring player they don't need to pretend to understand when they don't.

493.speaker: Player
493.text: Your efforts to topple Vlaakith are well underway, then.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I figured the lich queen would be dead by now. What's the hold up?

398.speaker: Lae'zel
398.text: Not all of us can play the weave like a lyre, Gale. Orpheus may be Prince of the Comet, but he is not a god.

237.speaker: Lae'zel
237.text: We've spilled blood, gained a foothold in the Astral. But still, we need allies. And one beyond reckoning has made itself known:

271.speaker: Narrator
271.text: *Zaerith Menyar-Ag-Gith. How well you know the name - the immortal god-king of the githzerai, and ruler of their capital, Shra'kt'lor.*

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *Zaerith Menyar-Ag-Gith - you've heard the name. The immortal god-king of the githzerai, and ruler of their capital, Shra'kt'lor.*

245.speaker: Lae'zel
245.text: Our gish sent word of the rebellion to Menyar-Ag-Gith through the cosmos. He's agreed to parley.

111.speaker: Lae'zel
111.text: It's fallen to me to secure an alliance.

526.speaker: Player
526.text: Hold on. The great warrior Lae'zel on a diplomatic mission?

357.speaker: Lae'zel
357.text: Heh. I was as surprised as anyone when Orpheus spoke the order, my love.

370.speaker: Lae'zel
370.text: Exactly the reaction I expected, my love.

457.speaker: Lae'zel
457.text: Heh. I was as surprised as anyone when Orpheus spoke the order.

191.speaker: Lae'zel
191.text: My blade is keen as ever. But it was you who showed me that a proper victory doesn't always require a razor-sharp edge.

530.speaker: Lae'zel
530.text: Sometimes, a sincere plea is more persuasive than a dagger against the neck.

346.speaker: Lae'zel
346.text: And sometimes, a bewitching smirk-and-quip gets the job done, Astarion-style.

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: Menyar-Ag-Gith is an ascetic. He reached out in good faith. This is his way. It is in this spirit that I must meet him.

222.speaker: Lae'zel
222.text: And if he refuses, I carry on. Gravity pulls me in but one direction.

491.speaker: Lae'zel
491.text: I am the Comet. I will not rest until I burn Vlaakith's bones to ash and smash her phylactery to pieces.

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.text: I am a Warrior of the Comet. I will not rest until I burn Vlaakith's bones to ash and smash her phylactery to pieces.

495.speaker: Lae'zel
495.context: NodeContext: Confident, almost returning to her old ways of fury...

363.speaker: Lae'zel
363.text: Chk - but you've heard that refrain before. Zealous, bossy, insistent. All part and parcel of my undeniable charm.
363.context: NodeContext: ...and now calming down, realising she's getting all zealous. Dryly but cutely.

541.speaker: Player
541.text: Reach out to Lae'zel. Seek the warmth of her touch.

459.speaker: Player
459.text: Reach out to Lae'zel. Seek the warmth of her touch.

622.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

633.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

604.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

531.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

513.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

487.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Lae'zel giver each other hug and kiss.

488.speaker: Lae'zel
488.text: O! That I could touch you in flesh, run my hands across your skin.

85.speaker: Lae'zel
85.text: I can feel you, even taste you in this form. But it is as if a thin layer of glass separates us. I can't quite have the whole of you.

23.speaker: Lae'zel
23.text: It's taken a dozen gishes' talents, a few stolen psi crystals, and two tendays of effort to conjure my projection.

572.speaker: Lae'zel
572.text: Worth every one of those days and every drop of their sweat, I promise you.

313.speaker: Player
313.text: I miss you, Lae'zel. Every moment apart has been torture.

135.speaker: Lae'zel
135.text: I know the feeling all too well.

28.speaker: Lae'zel
28.text: But that I can be in your presence at all is a wonder of its own.

475.speaker: Lae'zel
475.text: It has taken all of Orpheus' efforts to conjure my projection - and all of mine to convince him to let me come.

502.speaker: Lae'zel
502.text: Let's make the most of the moment, I say. May I kiss you?

143.speaker: Lae'zel
143.text: I can feel you, even taste you in this form. But it is as if a thin layer of glass separates us. I can't quite have the whole of you.

532.speaker: Lae'zel
532.text: But soon - soon I'll find some way to see you in flesh. To touch you as you are meant to be touched.

238.speaker: Lae'zel
238.text: And when the Comet has risen, we will be forever together, as surely as K'liir will forever circle the Sun.

574.speaker: Player
574.text: Not like this. I want to feel you in the flesh.

625.speaker: Lae'zel
625.text: I understand. I can touch and feel in this form, but it is as if a thin layer of glass separates us. I wouldn't have the whole of you.

329.speaker: Player
329.text: I miss you, Lae'zel. Every moment apart has been torture.

555.speaker: Player
555.text: A shame you couldn't be with us in person. It's like talking to a ghost.

112.speaker: Lae'zel
112.text: I suppose it is, rather. I'm just glad to be here at all.

380.speaker: Lae'zel
380.text: Worth it, I'd say. I missed this place. This - ahem - 'Fay-run'.
380.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a big smile. A reference to her misponunciation earlier in the game.

494.speaker: Lae'zel
494.text: More to the point - I missed you.

177.speaker: Lae'zel
177.text: But I'll be back to see you again when the Comet has risen, as surely as K'liir will forever circle the Sun.

355.speaker: Lae'zel
355.text: More to the point - I missed you. I wouldn't even deny it with Vlaakith's vorpal blade at my neck. Though I'd rather it not come to that.
355.context: NodeContext: Last bit a little more dryly, a bit of old Lae'zel.

11.speaker: Lae'zel
11.text: Now go, mingle a bit. That's the word, right? 'Mingle?'

294.speaker: Lae'zel
294.text: But don't think you've seen the last of me. I'll be back, sure as the Comet will rise, sure as K'liir will forever circle the Sun.

589.speaker: Player
589.text: If only Orpheus could have shared in your victories.

549.speaker: Lae'zel
549.text: I admit - I've longed for his guiding wisdom more than once. But I have not heard tell of him, nor has my mind felt his presence.

534.speaker: Lae'zel
534.text: Gith's son has been lost to the shadows. Perhaps one day, when the lich queen is dust, he will step into the light.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: When will I see you again?

566.speaker: Lae'zel
566.text: But for now, I say we make the most of the moment. May I kiss you?

268.speaker: Lae'zel
268.text: Soon - once you've restored Karlach's heart, once the lich queen has crumbled to dust.

288.speaker: Lae'zel
288.text: Soon - when the Comet has risen, when the lich queen has crumbled to dust.

599.speaker: Lae'zel
599.text: I missed this place. More to the point, I missed you.

277.speaker: Lae'zel
277.text: I missed this place. More to the point, I missed you. I wouldn't even deny it with Vlaakith's vorpal blade at my neck. Though I'd rather it not come to that.
277.context: NodeContext: Last bit a little more dryly, a bit of old Lae'zel.

124.speaker: Lae'zel
124.text: I'll be back one day. The Overgod himself couldn't keep me away.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Have you heard word from Orpheus since his departure?

551.speaker: Lae'zel
551.text: I have not heard tell of him, nor has my mind felt his presence.

250.speaker: Lae'zel
250.text: It seems Gith's son has been lost to the shadows. Perhaps one day, he will step into the light.

521.speaker: Player
521.text: And our little hatchling? Is he safe?

273.speaker: Lae'zel
273.text: Xan is with the mages of Xamvadi'm. I'd trust his care to no one else.

378.speaker: Lae'zel
378.text: Xan's destiny will be his own to follow. Warrior, poet, explorer, scholar. His way will be the way of the Comet:

562.speaker: Lae'zel
562.text: No chains to bind us, no lies to bury us. Liberty will be the rallying cry that unites our empire.

408.speaker: Player
408.text: What has become of the egg, Lae'zel? Has it hatched?

175.speaker: Player
175.text: What has become of the egg, Lae'zel? Has it hatched?

47.speaker: Lae'zel
47.text: So it has - and a fine man the hatchling will be. I call him Xan. 'Freedom'.

295.speaker: Lae'zel
295.text: He is with the mages of Xamvadi'm. I'd trust his care to no one else.

580.speaker: Lae'zel
580.text: And to you, Source of my Joy.

219.speaker: Lae'zel
219.text: Soon - soon I'll find some way to see you in flesh. To touch you as you are meant to be touched.

114.speaker: Lae'zel
114.context:
NodeContext: YISK GITH-kah TAV-ki KRAHSH-het, sheh-LAHK

Mother Gith's light guide you, great hero.

323.speaker: Lae'zel
323.text: Soon - soon I'll find some way to see you in flesh. To touch you as you are meant to be touched.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: The best choice for the job. Your tongue is as learned as your blade.

569.speaker: Lae'zel
569.text: You'd know better than anyone, my love.

263.speaker: Narrator
263.text: *'Love'. The word hangs in the air for a moment before Lae'zel continues, unfazed.*

38.speaker: Player
38.text: The enemy of my enemy is my friend, as they say.

93.speaker: Lae'zel
93.text: Sometimes. But I don't need the githzerai to fight for us - just with us, love.

481.speaker: Lae'zel
481.text: Sometimes. But I don't need the githzerai to fight for us - just with us.

436.speaker: Player
436.text: Sounds like a trap. This god-king will slay you the moment you show your face.

196.speaker: Lae'zel
196.text: Menyar-Ag-Gith is an ascetic. He reached out in good faith. This is his way. It is in this spirit that I must meet him, my love.

588.speaker: Lae'zel
588.text: And if Menyar-Ag-Gith refuses, I carry on.

484.speaker: Lae'zel
484.text: Menyar-Ag-Gith is an ascetic. He reached out in good faith. This is his way. It is in this spirit that I must meet him.

480.speaker: Player
480.text: Are you mad? The githzerai betrayed Mother Gith! They should be destroyed, not bargained with.

348.speaker: Player
348.text: An alliance? Do you think the Gith might again unite under one sky?

118.speaker: Lae'zel
118.text: You might as well ask if the stars will ever snuff out, or Avernus freeze over. A consideration for the far future.

470.speaker: Lae'zel
470.text: For now, I don't want the githzerai to fight for us - just with us, my love.

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: He is also a near-deity. Should the githzerai join us, we could topple The City of Death in a red dragon's blink.

110.speaker: Lae'zel
110.text: Should they refuse, I carry on. Gravity pulls me in but one direction.

444.speaker: Lae'zel
444.text: For now, I don't want the githzerai to fight for us - just with us.

172.speaker: Lae'zel
172.text: Not a what, but a who. The immortal god-king of the githzerai - an exiled people, once kin with mine until the madness of civil war ripped our one sky into two.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Nod your head as if the word means anything at all to you.

365.speaker: Lae'zel
365.text: No need to pretend - I know the word means little to you.

324.speaker: Lae'zel
324.text: Shra'kt'lor is the capital of the githzerai - an exiled people, once kin with mine until the madness of civil war ripped our one sky into two.

397.speaker: Lae'zel
397.text: Our gish sent word of the rebellion to their god-king Zaerith Menyar-Ag-Gith through the cosmos. He's agreed to parley.

581.speaker: Lae'zel
581.text: Not all of us can play the weave like a lyre, Gale. I am the Comet, not a god.

359.speaker: Player
359.text: You've been to Limbo? Does this mean you mean to ally with the githzerai?

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: I do. I approach the gates of Shra'kt'lor even now.

616.speaker: Lae'zel
616.text: For two months I trained the Knights of the Comet. For two more I skewered kith'raki bellies. And for two more yet I travelled through Limbo.

428.speaker: Lae'zel
428.text: That's my strapping girl. Burning hot - but not too hot, praise Withers.
428.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. She has been in service to Orpheus' cause, but happy to be here.

308.speaker: Lae'zel
308.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. She has been in service to Orpheus' cause, but happy to be here.

558.speaker: Lae'zel
558.context: CinematicNodeContext: Confident, but softer than ever. She has been in service to Orpheus' cause, but happy to be here.

87.speaker: Lae'zel
87.text: But to see Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard brings me even more pleasure than taking a royal inquisitor's head.

0.speaker: Lae'zel
0.text: But to see the Blade of Avernus brings me even more pleasure than taking a royal inquisitor's head.

498.speaker: Lae'zel
498.text: And to think you once held a blade to my throat. Not that I could blame you.

499.speaker: Lae'zel
499.text: But to see the Blade of Frontiers brings me even more pleasure than taking a royal inquisitor's head.

171.speaker: Lae'zel
171.text: But to see your face... it brings me even more pleasure than taking a royal inquisitor's head.

194.speaker: Lae'zel
194.text: Chk. A god stoops to walk among us.
194.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not sure she's happy to see you at first, but she comes around. But she starts with her old greeting.

181.speaker: Lae'zel
181.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not sure she's happy to see you at first, but she comes around. But she starts with her old greeting.

431.speaker: Lae'zel
431.text: I never imagined we'd be standing toe to toe on this day, in this place.

234.speaker: Lae'zel
234.text: Nothing but allies, I always told myself. A necessary partnership. But in spite of every strained word, every barbed glance -

628.speaker: Lae'zel
628.text: - seeing Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard brings me even more pleasure than taking a royal inquisitor's head.

180.speaker: Lae'zel
180.text: - seeing the Blade of Avernus brings me even more pleasure than taking a royal inquisitor's head.

32.speaker: Lae'zel
32.text: - seeing the Blade of Frontiers brings me even more pleasure than taking a royal inquisitor's head.

303.speaker: Lae'zel
303.text: - seeing you brings me even more pleasure than taking a royal inquisitor's head.

254.speaker: Lae'zel
254.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not sure she's happy to see you at first, but she comes around. But she starts with her old greeting.
